codeSystems.name: AuditEventAction
codeSystems.title: Audit Event Action
codeSystems.description: Indicator for type of action performed during the event that generated the event.

codeSystems.name: AuditEventSeverity
codeSystems.title: Audit Event Severity
codeSystems.description: The severity of the audit entry.

codeSystems.name: IssueSeverity
codeSystems.title: Issue Severity
codeSystems.description: How the issue affects the success of the action.

codeSystems.name: FHIRRestfulInteractions
codeSystems.title: FHIR Restful Interactions
codeSystems.description: The set of interactions defined by the RESTful part of the FHIR specification.

codeSystems.name: SampleSecurityStructuralRoles
codeSystems.title: Sample Codes for Security Structural Role
codeSystems.description: This codeSystem contains example structural roles. In general, two types of roles can be distinguished: structural roles and functional roles. Structural Roles reflect human or organizational categories (hierarchies), and describe prerequisites, feasibilities, or competences for actions. Functional roles are bound to the realization or performance of actions..

codeSystems.name: AuditEventID
codeSystems.title: Audit Event ID
codeSystems.description: Event Types for Audit Events - defined by DICOM with some FHIR specific additions.

codeSystems.name: SecurityRoleType
codeSystems.title: Security Role Type
codeSystems.description: This CodeSystem contains Additional FHIR-defined Security Role types not defined elsewhere

codeSystems.name: AuditEventEntityRole
codeSystems.title: AuditEventEntityRole
codeSystems.description: Code representing the role the entity played in the audit event.

codeSystems.name: OperationOutcomeCodes
codeSystems.title: Operation Outcome Codes
codeSystems.description: Operation Outcome codes used by FHIR test servers (see Implementation file translations.xml)

codeSystems.name: AuditEventSourceType
codeSystems.title: Audit Event Source Type
codeSystems.description: The type of process where the audit event originated from.

codeSystems.name: ActReason
codeSystems.title: ActReason
codeSystems.description:
A set of codes specifying the motivation, cause, or rationale of an Act, when such rationale is not reasonably represented as an ActRelationship of type "has reason" linking to another Act.

*Examples:* Example reasons that might qualify for being coded in this field might be: "routine requirement", "infectious disease reporting requirement", "on patient request", "required by law".
